meanings.definition: Relating to the period of study before entering law school.
meanings.sent1: She took prelaw classes to get ready for law school.
meanings.sent2: The prelaw student was excited to start her legal education.
meanings.sent3: The prelaw program felt like a stepping stone to her dream career.
meanings.sent4: Her prelaw journey was like laying the foundation for a strong building.
meanings.sent5: Studying prelaw subjects made her future goals clearer.

meanings.definition: A program of study designed to prepare students for law school.
meanings.sent1: He enrolled in a prelaw program to enhance his chances of getting into law school.
meanings.sent2: The prelaw at her university was rigorous but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: Joining the prelaw club helped him make friends with similar ambitions.
meanings.sent4: The prelaw curriculum included courses on legal writing and research.
meanings.sent5: Attending prelaw seminars gave her valuable insights into the legal field.
